header.topics: Music; bands, drumming, live and albums, Mutual friends, Internships, Plans
header.activity: Friends catching up with chat about music and life.

something where I could be on course here I think

erm and it felt kind of cool

without trying to feel personal like pride and all that
just knowing you're in that calm relationship
erm it was cool then doing something straight afterwards as well like going into work or
like going into a place where you can try and put it into practice
you know it set you up for uni well didn't it?

yeah I think so yeah dunno er yeah do you think your thing'll set you up well for what what do you think it's set you up most for? has it set you up most for do like to do kind of church working? or planting?
or like w actually just working in general and living life?
I think main the main thing that I've learnt this year is like from reading like the Celebration of Discipline and stuff like that is like
self like looking after yourself is really important like erm
half the time you look over it quite quickly and think oh okay I've gotta do this I've gotta do that but to take time out and say right actually I've gotta live live in this way
I've gotta do things not cos I have to but it's the best way of living for us
I think that's been the main if I could say er the one thing that I've done and learnt well it would be yeah to
get stuck into the right things
in terms of spending time with others as well as reading studying
yeah cos you've gotta have a good balance else you tire yourself out you get frustrated with others
you get put down by your work and stuff like that do you know what I mean?
but yeah if you take time out you can actually reflect on a few different things that you wouldn't necessarily think of
but yeah I think as well er like it sets you up well for well it does when you're at that age you need to learn these things like cos
else it hits you hard later on
so just to have a year where you say actually what's what is it you've gotta say to me? it's been pretty cool
but at the same time it's been really really nice seeing the youth grow in different ways in the church
the main one for me has been incredible this year
and and that sort of age group but mainly 's been the main influence I think on that group and has grown massively this year
watching him pray for others at or just after prayer on a Sunday
mainly praying but in other ways as well with what he's come up with and stuff like that it's just been cool so good to see
so yeah it's it's always encouraging when you know that stuff like that can happen
if you allow it to happen and you give them opportunities
so would he've done stuff like that before?
he would've got there I'm sure but
it's been nice to actually say do this
come on cos like yeah I've pushed him in ways that he probably wouldn't've thought I would've as well as pushed him in ways that he probably wouldn't want me to've pushed him at
but now I'm sure he's fine with it
cos like yeah just the way it has gotta be isn't it?
he plays keys as well doesn't he?
he does he's done that a few times
at the front which has been cool
it's kind of interesting how you how you teach the things you were saying about like the finding the right way to live
how you teach that to people I think is a really interesting question dilemma isn't it?
how would you go about would you do it the same way you've been taught like at ? or?
do you think you need to teach people? or is it something they find on their own?
so some things that quite often on Monday or er Sunday mornings
so sometimes I hear a talk on Monday and I think w if I have to say that to someone how would I say it? so you might have to tailor certain things
or you might wanna change it completely but most of the time I've just kept it fairly simple
so just like what's the main points here?
okay how are we gonna branch out from that?
so one thing that I've especially done for is got them to actually do most of the work for themselves
so I get up a blackboard I'll put the topic in the middle and then I'll just say right branch out from this what what sort of things er can you get?
but it's based around a Bible story or a Bible passage or something that

reflects from it so then they're learning the Bible they're reading out the Bible but they're not just doing that and thinking okay so that's what it meant back then they're s going right what does that mean now?
so I'll show you some examples in a minute but yeah it's been cool watching them do that and then as well cos that's on the board afterwards I get them to pray

so like erm I'll go round the circle saying guys we're gonna pray now it'll be good for us all to pray and if you can't think of anything then look at the board cos they've just put all the answers there themselves
so eventually that starts making them think again so that w that's been the main thing that's worked well for them for and for me
cos like sometimes it's hard to know what to teach what to say
if they're gonna enjoy it but at the same time sometimes if you do that all the time they're just gonna get ah it's we know what we've gotta do it's gonna be boring
so the one thing that I need er tto start doing more of is putting like activities into it as well
so like maybe it could be go outside and play a game and how that can link in or stuff I don't know but
it'd just be a good idea to mix it up a bit
mate that sounds incredible sounds like
sounds like erm you've nailed a lot in the last year sounds
yeah it's been cool to just been given time to do stuff so like 's been on holiday so I've had to lead Friday night socials
's not been able to talk on a Sunday so I've had to have a little time to think about wha okay what can I do?
and like just opening up and having them work in front of me and stuff like that like it's stuff that is fairly simple and anyone can do it but it's just h
just thinking okay so in fact I've got to do it so what can I do sort of thing?
but yeah it's been nice just to have opportunity cos 's very flexible anyway he says do you wanna do this? do you wanna do that?
sort of thing he won't say you've gotta do this for next week cos er obviously it's quite hard if you've gotta think of something in a week to say
do you know what I mean?
but it's been nice to h just have that flexibility to say I trust you to do this if you want to you can
cos obviously it opens it up a bit then doesn't it?
we have quite a lot of support around us as well like so far we've had so many more drummers turn up which has been great just playing like prayer
so it just means that I don't have to do so much
of the things that I have to do sort of thing cos no one else will do them
so it means that I've got more flexibility again to say oh I can do this now
or do you know what I mean?
yeah I haven't done a I haven't drummed on Sunday mornings except from the all age
which has been cool cos obviously I don't have to go out then to the groups cos they're not on
so I do three times then I can go out and once I can stay in the service which is really nice as well as I h don't really do too much travelling in the evenings but obviously I can on that
so that's been good but it's also been nice just to spend some time thinking well okay what's God trying to say in this service?
is there anything I can add? or even if it's just to set up or pack down it's just
it's just more flexible isn't it?
mate they're gonna miss you when you go probably it'll collapse
well yeah I think yes and no cos like
you say that but then that means that again it's just opening it up for someone else to do
cos like and that er they're at that age now where they can still help out
they don't have to I'm not saying that they're gonna take over and do all the service themselves but it means again they've got time to say oh can you help me do this? and just get them involved
it's all about next generation isn't it?
it is oh mate that's cool it's very inspiring I think
yeah it's good to see you though
I definitely haven't been as involved in the in the churches rock up play keys every now and again
so do you do a lot of
worship stuff? er or is it just turn up on the day ?
erm you do er you do it once a month
you join and band there's a band every week different band every week
is that good or bad do you reckon? or would you prefer it if it was the same band?
erm it's good because lots of people get to play
not everyone gets to but that's like a motto
the reason that you don't really gel and er good for variety I guess
but the ideal would be just like paid musicians who maybe that's an ideal but or at least paid quality
but I dunno what the ideal is it's kinda cool
but yeah that's been cool so I had like that once a week and then lead occasionally
oh yeah once or one or two
yeah yeah I think they were
cos you you you're a guy who doesn't like too much change when it comes to when you play
you like knowing your set list fairly far in advance and
if you can change it you can
but you know to you like to know what you've got don't you?
yeah I like the biggest thing I've learnt with that is because the band's like completely new band last week
or the week before I was leading with a completely new band
so I learnt about how to be really direct with what you want
and er to practise really thoroughly and like spell out to people what what you need them to do
cos they were just like wouldn't have a clue
whereas like if I play with you that's good
but we can bounce off ideas off each other and like
say erm yeah it's something I like yeah we were playing just I dunno
I don't know what you do if you

what would you say like the the if you could ssay there's someone who's fifteen who's gonna try and start worship leading what would you say for when he's practising what would your first best tip would be for him?
ah that's a great question I'd like to hear yours as well
do you know? I think the biggest one would be ah there's not one it's it's two there's two
erm one is worship and worship worship
erm and worship like when you're on your own erm worship when someone else is leading who you want to be
you want to be up there worship them just worship all the time and the second one is listen erm
and if if you're in the band listening should be should be l eighty percent of what you're doing should be listening
erm and also when you're worship leading you're listening to God and you're listening to what you are playing you're listening to what everyone else is doing
trying to tune into what everyone else is doing so develop your worshipping and develop your listening I would say

u.unclear: two erm most important things I can think of

body.u: er what would you say? would you add anything?
I think you've done well there I think like you said worship worship worship in terms of
yeah erm in terms of yeah what you've got to do some people try and listen to too much music and get it wrong that way cos they're
too busy trying to think oh I've gotta play these amazing chords and do it in a certain way
but they forget they're actually on a stage cos it's worshiping God they're trying to worship songs
so I'd say don't spend too much time listening to music try and play it just without anything
okay try and get some okay yeah yeah
just just go for it that way
but in terms of listening I think that's really important cos
you know when you're fifteen you could still just in terms of church
cos that's really how I learnt how to play drums I think
just from hearing other people drumming and then that tau
yeah yeah that's very good that's how I learnt tennis as well not listening to people drumming
did you have? you had lessons though did you? did you have any lessons?
some I had I learnt how to play
I self-taught myself how to play
but then erm after a while I had a few lessons but that was reading music it wasn't how to play
erm but yeah that was probably for about a year maybe
cos now you're really good really good
yeah but I've forgotten all of what I learnt in my lessons in terms of how to read sheet music
if you put a sheet in front of me I'd be able to figure it out roughly but I wouldn't
yeah well you've got all the rudiments so
but I find people who learn how to play drums through lessons in terms of music aren't always the best at playing
cos they're too busy caught up in reading that they're actually in rhythm they're not always self-aware as well
especially in a church cos sometimes if you try and play it to a track that's actually not gonna work cos you need to thin it out cos
you've gotta almost like act differently you have to react to what's going on around you
yeah yeah you gotta anticipate like the closing of a of a section or like
the building of a section before it even happens so that you're ready for it
and to keep it in time it's a really tricky instrument to play whereas acoustic guitar you can just like fumble around a little bit and
do you play bar chords? or do you play?
do you play D chords? D shaped chords? or C? or E?
oh erm favourite is like G shapes
so you have a lot going on in the bass but also I know my G scale is I've got scale masters probably the only scale I know
like that yeah do you like jazz drumming? have you ever done jazz drumming?
I haven't done too much of it but it always sound great
little shuffles mm does sound really cool
we like Snarky Puppy at the moment
have you heard of Snarky Puppy?
I've heard it mentioned but I don't think I've heard much of their music
it's very cool think we're very cool listening to it
's got into reggae quite a lot and he likes
that's quite cool to try and have a little
have you heard erm Deep Cries Out Reggae?
so basically William Matthews is on stage and he starts erm Deep Cries Out Reggae
and then he just turns it into the actual normal version
it's pretty cool yeah you gotta hear it
those guys practise so much don't they?
yeah they must I reckon they probably practise twice a week
yeah crazy musicians and then they're probably like working in music the whole week
yeah be er quite a cool life thought wouldn't it? spending that much time together and just
it would yeah w do you fancy doing do you fancy doing that as a job?
that would be pretty cool I would like that
but again sometimes you can get stuck in a bubble which isn't helpful
like your own if you're with it all the time like yeah you almost get lose your sight of what the real life's like
I think like yeah going to Kenya and stuff like that that would be a good eye opener
how's your sister getting on? cos that's a completely different isn't it?
think so we skyped er yesterday
she's doing yeah she seems to be doing well got got a big tan
when are you going to Kenya?
yeah just checking that's working should be it's fine
erm I'm going first of erm July
have to see how it goes but that can yeah can go one of two ways you can either really love it or you get a bit disheartened from it can't you? so yeah
I don't think I'll get disheartened but again you can never tell until you're there
yeah it's true I've never understood the erm the bubble theory actually
I've never understood that erm partly partly because I think and this is my claclassic literature philosophy but bubbles are er such a a function of everyday life in the in the sense that
you can never be outside of a bubble if it's if we say that so say you hang out with er you're the band
er say you're working for Bethel
or s or a church and you're you're on their team

and you're like playing drums and then you you help you're like er mentoring a few kids and they're like doing stuff at youth services erm and you spend all your time with them er there's no reason to say that that's not the real world
because someone who is in the real world so for example they work at Tesco's
because that to us seems like it's the real world cos it's outside our bubble
they are in a system of bubbles themselves aren't they?

erm and their idea of the real world exists outside of their spheres so I I can understand where it where it comes from but and we do need to be connected with different I guess it's just saying that we need to be connected with different like ways of people different types of people isn't it?
like so we don't lose focus is it?
it is kind of good it's kind of a noble idea actually
but yeah I don't think we should be afraid of culture and stuff
no it's good we had a talk a little while ago about the body of church

and saying how it's so important that we need so many different people erm just in terms of instead of obviously saying we need we need a vicar we need a worship leader cos obviously that's fairly self-explanatory
but saying how we need people who work in the church just what and they're people who work in the church for the church in terms of making it as good as it can be inside
as well as we need people working in the church for the outside church as well as people who come to the church for the outside church
and people come f to the church for the church
and how obviously if you don't have outreach no one's gonna be new is gonna be coming in if you don't have in-reach then you're too busy being out there and your church isn't surviving
obviously you've heard it all before but it's pretty cool just erm again
no that's kind of cool to hear it as a model actually
yeah that's quite fun trying to figure out wait hang on where are we?
are we in the church? out the church?
coming to the church? going out the church?
are you where do you where do you fit yourself?
I fit so if I'm in the church cos obviously I'm doing the er internship for the church
but as well as that I'm outside the church cos I'm working as a chef
but yeah I don't know I haven't done much outreach this year in terms of
inviting people but at the same time I'm with youth all the time who bring new mates so I'm s kind of
in that chain but not really outreaching
yeah do many of the kids bring th bring their mates?
we've had so many new faces in the last year
yeah it has grown but again that's not always a good thing cos if it's growing too much you're not actually investing in the newcomers as well as the old-comers
cos you're too busy trying to say hello to everyone remember people's names
and try and make them fit in that some of the old people might not feel quite so involved
but again again if you're not getting anyone in then it becomes too much of the normal
yeah it's really hard been trying to figure out how I should be in how it is
and what you need to be doing
yeah that's the hardest bit sometimes
cos obviously if someone comes in name
